channel.title: Caving
channel.description:
I live in Indiana for the most part, and around the southern area we have lots of caves.
Was just wonder has anybody else went caving before? I have always loved it and go about every other week. Does anybody think anything of the sport?

item.title: Caving
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Squigglyo, post:17, topic:237489”]go into a cave, deep into it. Take a portable DVD player, and watch

The Descent

should make your caving experience oh so much more exciting.[/quote]
watched it on the way there lol

Read full topic

item.title: Caving
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“maniown, post:16, topic:237489”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=313556.msg2496745#msg2496745 date=1224439422]

I live in Indiana for the most part, and around the southern area we have lots of caves.

Was just wonder has anybody else went caving before? I have always loved it and go about every other week. Does anybody think anything of the sport?

I remember going Caving in the Lake District, I believe the cave was Long Churn with the Cheese Press - It’s a brilliant thing to do just not if you hate small spaces. Oh and a tip would be to do exactly what you’re told also - At the beginning of the Long Churn caves where we went the guide told us to climb down the ledge at slow as possible and to cut a long story short with me being a dick head I ended up jumping into 19ft of freezing cold water.
[/quote]Well i dont go with a guide. I have fell into water as well. It sucks a lot for the rest of the trip.[/quote]

I found it fucking epic when I dove in, and for the rest of the trip it was still brilliant, went under an underground waterfall etc.

Read full topic

I live in Indiana for the most part, and around the southern area we have lots of caves.

Was just wonder has anybody else went caving before? I have always loved it and go about every other week. Does anybody think anything of the sport?
[/quote]

I remember going Caving in the Lake District, I believe the cave was Long Churn with the Cheese Press - It’s a brilliant thing to do just not if you hate small spaces. Oh and a tip would be to do exactly what you’re told also - At the beginning of the Long Churn caves where we went the guide told us to climb down the ledge at slow as possible and to cut a long story short with me being a dick head I ended up jumping into 19ft of freezing cold water.[/quote]Well i dont go with a guide. I have fell into water as well. It sucks a lot for the rest of the trip.

item.title: Caving
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“maniown, post:1, topic:237489”]I live in Indiana for the most part, and around the southern area we have lots of caves.

Was just wonder has anybody else went caving before? I have always loved it and go about every other week. Does anybody think anything of the sport?[/quote]

I remember going Caving in the Lake District, I believe the cave was Long Churn with the Cheese Press - It’s a brilliant thing to do just not if you hate small spaces. Oh and a tip would be to do exactly what you’re told also - At the beginning of the Long Churn caves where we went the guide told us to climb down the ledge at slow as possible and to cut a long story short with me being a dick head I ended up jumping into 19ft of freezing cold water.
